page.title: Humanitarian response by non-governmental organizations to the 2010 Haiti earthquake

rev.comment: rm iconization of fair use image failing [[WP:NFCC]] #8

Line 113: Line 113:
==={{flag|United Kingdom}}===
==={{flag|United Kingdom}}===
*The [[Disasters Emergency Committee]] (DEC), an umbrella organisation for 13 UK-registered humanitarian aid agencies, launched an appeal for relief efforts in Haiti which as of 10 July 2010 has raised Â£101 million (US$152 million) in donations. Interventions which have so far been provided from these funds include: clean drinking water for over 250,000 people; emergency shelter for over 100,000 people; building 3,000 latrines; over 2,500 âcash for workâ public service projects; medical consultations for over 100,000 people; and supplementary feeding for 1,890 malnourished children.<ref name="DEC"> {{cite web|url=http://www.dec.org.uk/item/433|title=DEC press release 433 |accessdate=10 July 2010}}</ref> A poll conducted on behalf of the DEC by the [[Charities Aid Foundation]] over the 23rd and 24th of January indicated that 48% of the UK public had so far donated, and of those that hadn't yet, 62% might or were planning to. <ref name="DEC2">{{cite web |title=DEC press release 414 |url=http://www.dec.org.uk/item/414}}</ref>
*The [[Disasters Emergency Committee]] (DEC), an umbrella organisation for 13 UK-registered humanitarian aid agencies, launched an appeal for relief efforts in Haiti which as of 10 July 2010 has raised Â£101 million (US$152 million) in donations. Interventions which have so far been provided from these funds include: clean drinking water for over 250,000 people; emergency shelter for over 100,000 people; building 3,000 latrines; over 2,500 âcash for workâ public service projects; medical consultations for over 100,000 people; and supplementary feeding for 1,890 malnourished children.<ref name="DEC"> {{cite web|url=http://www.dec.org.uk/item/433|title=DEC press release 433 |accessdate=10 July 2010}}</ref> A poll conducted on behalf of the DEC by the [[Charities Aid Foundation]] over the 23rd and 24th of January indicated that 48% of the UK public had so far donated, and of those that hadn't yet, 62% might or were planning to. <ref name="DEC2">{{cite web |title=DEC press release 414 |url=http://www.dec.org.uk/item/414}}</ref>

*[[Humanity First|Humanity First UK]]<ref>http://www.humanityfirst.org.uk/</ref>
*[[St Eugene's Cathedral]] in [[Derry]], [[Northern Ireland]] raised almost Â£25,000 by 20 January 2010.<ref>{{cite news|author =|title=Church raises Â£25,000 for Haiti|publisher =BBC News|date =January 20, 2010 | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/northern_ireland/foyle_and_west/8468265.stm| accessdate=2010-01-21}}</ref>
*[[St Eugene's Cathedral]] in [[Derry]], [[Northern Ireland]] raised almost Â£25,000 by 20 January 2010.<ref>{{cite news|author =|title=Church raises Â£25,000 for Haiti|publisher =BBC News|date =January 20, 2010 | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/northern_ireland/foyle_and_west/8468265.stm| accessdate=2010-01-21}}</ref>
*United Haitians in the UK (UHUK) have been collecting donations of supplies to send out and helping Haitians in the UK make contact with their relatives.<ref>UHUK website http://www.uhuk.org/</ref>
*United Haitians in the UK (UHUK) have been collecting donations of supplies to send out and helping Haitians in the UK make contact with their relatives.<ref>UHUK website http://www.uhuk.org/</ref>
Line 132: Line 132:
* The Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara Society, a [[Sikh]] temple from [[Surrey]], [[British Columbia]], along with local South Asian radio stations, managed to raise over $100,000 CAD in donations on January 14, 2010.<ref>{{cite web|last=Diakiw |first=Kevin |url=http://www.bclocalnews.com/surrey_area/surreyleader/news/81746007.html |title=Surrey Leader - Temple raises $100K first day |publisher=Bclocalnews.com |date= |accessdate=2010-01-16}}</ref>
* The Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara Society, a [[Sikh]] temple from [[Surrey]], [[British Columbia]], along with local South Asian radio stations, managed to raise over $100,000 CAD in donations on January 14, 2010.<ref>{{cite web|last=Diakiw |first=Kevin |url=http://www.bclocalnews.com/surrey_area/surreyleader/news/81746007.html |title=Surrey Leader - Temple raises $100K first day |publisher=Bclocalnews.com |date= |accessdate=2010-01-16}}</ref>
**As of January 21, $1,500,000 had been raised by the temple and radio stations. A portion of the money will be given to the Governor General of Canada to be given directly to the Haitian government, while the remainder will go to support [[MÃ©decins Sans FrontiÃ¨res]] (Doctor's Without Borders) and United Sikhs, an NGO which provides disaster relief Haiti<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unitedsikhs.org/haitiearthquake/ |title=Recognize the Human Race as One |publisher=United Sikhs |date= |accessdate=2010-01-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Ferguson |first=Dan |url=http://www.bclocalnews.com/surrey_area/surreyleader/news/82307862.html |title=Surrey Leader - Surrey temple fundraiser collects $1.5 million for Haitian relief |publisher=Bclocalnews.com |date= |accessdate=2010-01-21}}</ref>
**As of January 21, $1,500,000 had been raised by the temple and radio stations. A portion of the money will be given to the Governor General of Canada to be given directly to the Haitian government, while the remainder will go to support [[MÃ©decins Sans FrontiÃ¨res]] (Doctor's Without Borders) and United Sikhs, an NGO which provides disaster relief Haiti<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unitedsikhs.org/haitiearthquake/ |title=Recognize the Human Race as One |publisher=United Sikhs |date= |accessdate=2010-01-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Ferguson |first=Dan |url=http://www.bclocalnews.com/surrey_area/surreyleader/news/82307862.html |title=Surrey Leader - Surrey temple fundraiser collects $1.5 million for Haitian relief |publisher=Bclocalnews.com |date= |accessdate=2010-01-21}}</ref>

*[[Humanity First|Humanity First Canada]] <ref>http://www.humanityfirst.ca/</ref> held several fundraising events for Haiti appeal.<ref> http://www.newswire.ca/en/releases/archive/January2010/23/c3456.html</ref>
*[[Inuit Tapiriit Kanatami]] collected $90,000 to the relief effort.<ref>[http://www.theglobeandmail.com/blogs/bureau-blog/inuit-chip-in-on-haitian-relief/article1433065/ Inuit chip in on Haitian relief ]</ref>
*[[Inuit Tapiriit Kanatami]] collected $90,000 to the relief effort.<ref>[http://www.theglobeandmail.com/blogs/bureau-blog/inuit-chip-in-on-haitian-relief/article1433065/ Inuit chip in on Haitian relief ]</ref>
* The Canadian Salvation Army.<ref>[http://www.flickr.com/photos/salvationarmy/sets/72157623203832664/ Canadian Salvation Army on Flickr]</ref>

Line 198: Line 198:
*[[Habitat for Humanity]] - Sent an assessment team on January 13, 2010.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.habitat.org/newsroom/2010archive/01_13_2010_Haiti_Earthquake.aspx |title=Addressing housing needs in Haiti after major earthquake |publisher=Habitat for Humanity |accessdate=2010-01-14}}</ref>
*[[Habitat for Humanity]] - Sent an assessment team on January 13, 2010.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.habitat.org/newsroom/2010archive/01_13_2010_Haiti_Earthquake.aspx |title=Addressing housing needs in Haiti after major earthquake |publisher=Habitat for Humanity |accessdate=2010-01-14}}</ref>
*[[Hands On Disaster Response]] has a mission of staff and up to eighty volunteers in Leogane conducting inter-organization coordination and logistical support, medical support, demolition of damaged houses, and temporary and transitional shelter design, fabrication and disbursement. The mission is slated to run until August, 2010.
*[[Hands On Disaster Response]] has a mission of staff and up to eighty volunteers in Leogane conducting inter-organization coordination and logistical support, medical support, demolition of damaged houses, and temporary and transitional shelter design, fabrication and disbursement. The mission is slated to run until August, 2010.
